alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 2:17PM MDT until August 16 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Kane County in southern Utah... * Until 500 PM MDT. * At 217 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain, particularly across Coyote Wash, House Rock Valley Road, Wire Pass, and Buckskin Gulch. Approximately 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially within slot canyons such as Wire Pass and Buckskin Gulch. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, dry washes, creeks and streams. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wire Pass, Buckskin Gulch, House Rock Valley Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
